citation.article-title: The taxonomic status of the fermentative halophilic anaerobic bacteria: description of Haloanaerobiales ord. nov., Halobacteroidaceae fam. nov., Orenia gen. nov. and further taxonomic rearrangements at the genus and species level.

p.s: Halobacteroidaceae (Ha.lo.bac.te.ro.i.da'ce.ae. Halobacteroides type genus of the family; -aceae denoting a family. M.L.n. Halobacteroidaceae the Halobacteroides family)
Gram-negative rods, motile, spore-forming or non-sporforming, obligate anaerobes, halophilic, growing optimally at NaCl concentrations of ~9-18%.
The G+C content of the DNA ranges from 30-35%.
Distinct genomic properties are present in the 16s DNA primary and secondary structure, defined by a set of signature nucleotides.
The type genus of the family Halobacteroides (Oren et al. [14]).
Additional genera are Acetohalobium, Haloanaerobacter, Orenia, and Sporohalobacter.
